text: Hey @pavelbelousov, appreciate the fix! @Akirtovskis, thanks for the speedy translations to the new settings! Looks like an unclosed `code` tag along with the `p` tag. I'll push a fix for it now. @LHSnow, thanks for the bug report. Fix on the way. Hey @Akirtovskis, welcome to the open source world and thanks for your contribution! Adding a comma will display like that so no need to worry or do anything different. The translation looks good, but there are a few spots in `levels.js` where you added a line return in the middle of the string: * [line 75](https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/pull/135/files#diff-118461f2d0f90667d59f0beb7dc2deabR75) * [line 196](https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/pull/135/files#diff-118461f2d0f90667d59f0beb7dc2deabR196) * [line 843](https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/pull/135/files#diff-118461f2d0f90667d59f0beb7dc2deabR843) Can you delete the returns so all the text is on a single line? You make make a new commit for it, then I'll merge in your work. Let me know if you have any questions. Looks like you missed one at line 841. Otherwise looks ready to go! Perfect, I'll merge this in now. Honored to have our project be your first PR. Nice work! You might need to flush your browser cache to get it to show. Hey @ajrussellaudio, thanks for your work on this. We've gotten many requests for a color blind mind so this is a welcome and overdue feature. Everything looks great. Just one small tweak. The real estate is tight as it is, so could you restyle the toggle color blind mode button to match the language menu, and place it inline to the right of it in the footer? Looks great. Let's merge it in! Thanks MeenChul! Looks great David, thanks for the translation! Thanks, assuming this will fix the tooltip issue with the hard mode PR though? Hey @mcshiz, thanks for this pull request, looks good and I love the idea of randomizing levels on top of hiding the instructions. One issue is that it won't be immediately obvious what the different levels do. How about if we do a pop-up (like for languages) for Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced with short descriptions of what each does. Would you be up for working on that? The menu looks great, just what I was hoping for. I noticed a new bug with the padding of the properties tooltips. Aside from that, it looks good to go. Merged! Hey @joykuotw, thanks for refining the translations. Grateful for your efforts! @diabloevagto, thanks for the translation! 👏 👏 👏 Thanks @shuuji3! Thanks for the correction @not0000! @lmintmate, looks great, thanks for this translation. I'll merge it in now! @kant, thanks for the fixes! Can't replicate this on Firefox 56 on Mac. Could you try disabling your add-ons and see if it's still a problem? Thanks. @laurensclaessen, much appreciate the translation! Many thanks for the tweaks, @tuanphpvn. @BoyWithSilverWings, thanks for the translation, glad to add Malayalam to the list. Will also add you to the readme. 😃 Thank you sir. 👍 Hey @Repjarms, looks like that gap shows up due to rounding error. Would love a PR on this! @LittaPanda, thanks for the bug report. Does it happen when you run Froggy in incognito mode? How about if you clear browser data for flexboxfroggy.com? Any reason the Parse script at https://unpkg.com/parse@1.9.2/dist/parse.min.js might not be loading? Maybe a browser extension is blocking it? Hoping to add this feature eventually, but in the meantime, Programming Mentor has put together this nice guide: http://programmingmentor.com/post/playing-css-grid-garden/ Hey @SherylHohman, thanks for your comments. Point well taken about level 14 causing misconceptions about how `order` works. I'll look into tweaking something like the order of the levels or adding a clue to the level 15 instructions to help people get unstuck. There are a couple of things that help with this right now though. First is players can freely move back and forth between levels to review earlier info. Second is that you can hover underlined properties to get similar info. For `order`, it also gives you example values: Your suggestion in #110 to add hints or solutions would also help deal with this. Hey @neotan, thanks for the refinements! Hey @pckltr, looks good, but can you keep the languages on `index.html` in the original order and add Romanian after Magyar? They're roughly ordered by geography so similar languages can be grouped together. Thanks! @leonine90, thanks for the tweaks, and again for your work on translating [Grid Garden](https://github.com/thomaspark/gridgarden)! Hey @ocelotluke, thanks for your thoughtful suggestions. I'm very open to the idea of providing supplemental materials, which could take many different forms. The GitHub wiki might be a good way to collaborate on this. Pages can be created for per-level explanations as well as a cheat sheet that explains in more detail the different properties/values, and also links to additional resources. And then we could link back from Froggy to the individual wiki pages where relevant. Downside of this is that when Froggy is used as a class activity, students can just copy & paste answers from the wiki instead of working through it. Or we could have the explanations more deeply integrated with the game. Make full explanations only available when a level is completed. I have gotten notes from people that they use Froggy as an interactive reference. They go back to specific levels and experiment with different values to get a better grasp on a certain property. Maybe if the levels had descriptions (e.g., hover over a number in the level menu to get a tooltip of its topic), it could help this use case. @ivandevp, thanks for the corrections. 😄 Sure, you can hit the reset link here to clear everything out: Just spotted this missing Japanese string while working on the language menu: https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/messages.js#L75 @ginpei, would you be able to add it? Ah, thanks for the explanation, I had no idea. We can leave it as is then! Awesome, thanks @gbhasha! Thanks @peterver, looks good to me! ![gridgarden](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900407/24732242/b0689f02-1a3d-11e7-8168-8fb4a4d48951.png) Just put the finishing touches on Grid Garden: http://cssgridgarden.com/ https://github.com/thomaspark/gridgarden Loved the Grid Giraffe idea but sadly couldn't get it to work. 😛 Turns out a carrot is much easier to draw than a giraffe! Hey Danko, thanks for this! I'll do a more thorough review soon, but can you make one quick change? Change the language key from `ser` to `sr`, which is the [official ISO code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) for Serbian. Thanks, just one more thing I spotted. You missed the translation at the end of `levels.js`: https://github.com/dankoknad/flexboxfroggy/blob/cba3379d25736cd68af64b76760cf8f60cab4e57/js/levels.js#L805 Otherwise, looks good to go! Merged! Danko, much thanks for your contribution. Hey Shubham, thanks for this, really glad to finally have a Hindi translation! @KochetkovEgor, thanks for the fix! Thanks @mihailgaberov. Thanks Christian! @mihailgaberov, thanks for contributing this translation! Hey @coliff, thanks for this. Hey @theJollySin, feel free to use the the images. I'm adding a note in the README that they are released under Creative Commons CC BY 3.0 license, which only requires attribution. Hey @shadoll, this is looking great. Can you just switch the lang code to `uk`? While `ua` is used for country, `uk` is used for the language (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes). Thanks! I would definitely be open to something this. Maybe an alternate color palette, or giving the frogs different patterns. Other ideas? Thanks Daniel for the pull request, I'm sure the examples will be a big help to some of the new coders out there! Thanks for the suggestion, I'd be open to a PR for this. Maybe something as simple as a parenthetical with example numbers would be enough. This would be easy to add to all translations as well. Something like: > ...we can use this property to set it to a positive or negative integer value. (...-2, -1, 0, 1, 2,...) @zbtn, thanks for the corrections! Thanks! Hey Martin, thanks for the translation. Much appreciated! Thanks Harvey. Looks great! Works ok for me on Firefox 46.0.1. Are you seeing any errors in console? Hey @sunsheeppoplar, thanks for this translation. Looks good to me. Hi @dm-wyncode, the Hungarian translation was recently added. A bug is causing the new Hungarian instructions to overwrite English for levels 14 and 15. Thanks for your detailed report — I was able to track it down and will push a fix shortly. Hi Adam, thanks so much for your translation. It looks ready to go! @rankill, thanks for the typo fixes! But looks like you committed some unrelated changes since then. Ok, will close this issue. Cheers. @ginpei, thanks so much for this translation! I'll go ahead and merge this. Agree that CJK should be clustered together, but I can take care of this myself. Hey @liberaliscomputing, I left a few comments on your PR. Thanks. Thanks for the tweaks. Thanks for the fix! Thanks! @MightyPork, thanks for the translation. Could you squash all of your changes into one single commit for the pull request? @kingstenbanh, thank you! @eLGi, thanks for the translation! Thanks, this is great. But can you keep the PR to just the translation? Instead of adding gitignore to this project, I recommend setting up a [global gitignore](https://help.github.com/articles/ignoring-files/#create-a-global-gitignore). Merged in #55 You should be able to just hit "enter" to submit your answer, but making it more semantic and accessible doesn't hurt. Pushing a change for this now. Thanks for the suggestion. Thanks for the fix! Awesome, thanks @justutiz! Meen Chul, this is great. Thanks for your help. Grazie! Much appreciated! Thanks for this. Many thanks for this, @timguoqk! @timguoqk, just spotted that a translation for "Level" is missing here: https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/messages.js#L32 Can you provide one? Ah, thanks for the clarification. @alihaddadkar, this is awesome, thanks for it. Thanks! Wonderful. :smile: Thanks for the translation, @artem328. How does something like #27 sound? Repeating the levels with the instructions toggled off. I was also thinking about a mode that generates levels with a random combination of properties. Thanks, the whole thing is due for a refactor (see #24) but this is nice improvement in the meantime. Hi @alihaddadkar, thanks for this. A few comments: - Changes to the CSS should be minimized. For example, if the Farsi displays ok without adding the custom font, it should be removed. - Likewise, there shouldn't be any changes to the HTML. Chances are we'll be moving to a single HTML doc soon, so they'll get wiped anyway. I do plan to add a README that will credit all of the translators' contributions. - To support interface changes for RTL (e.g., setting `direction: rtl;`, reversing the previous/next buttons), perhaps we can set a `rtl` class to body using JS and add styles using that. - There's also a bigger question about changes to the levels themselves. RTL means the horizontal axis of flexbox is also flipped. Allowing that to happen means the wording of the instructions may also need to be changed. To use Tahoma, you could try something like: ``` html[lang="fa"] { font-family: Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif; } ``` How about applying RTL like this: ``` #instructions, #credits { direction: rtl; } ``` By the way, the language stuff has been reworked. There's just a single `index.html` file now, and all the translations can be made in the JS files. This is fantastic. Thanks @manuelitox, for improving the Google Translate versions as well. :smile: I'll be sure to tag you if any translations are need in the future. Thanks for the tweaks! There are a few new Portuguese translations left to do. In https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/messages.js: - "Reset" - "Are you sure you want to reset the game?\n\nYour saved progress will be lost and you\'ll be sent to the start of the game." @mvtenorio, mind helping out with these? :smile: Thank you! There are a few new German translations left to do. In https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/lang/de/index.html#L25: - "Level" In https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/messages.js: - "Reset" - "Are you sure you want to reset the game?\n\nYour saved progress will be lost and you\'ll be sent to the start of the game." Can someone help with these? (@tfrommen :wink:) Thanks @tfrommen, the way languages are handled is definitely due for a refactor. Your approach looks good to me, though I might prefer to use a query string than automatically detect the user language. I'll merge your changes for now and hopefully get to that soon. Hi @Notuom, this is just super. Not only the French translation but the other improvements. Thanks! Thanks for the suggestion, there was similar discussion also in #14. I'm making the switch from png to svg. The image load drops from 49kb to 25kb and as for image quality, you can judge for yourself. PNG left, SVG right. Hi @solsend2l, thanks for your comments! I agree that level 24 is pretty tough, but I intended it to be like that to give the opportunity to play around with all of the properties one last time, and as a "boss level" final challenge to add a sense of accomplishment. I hope you found the previous 23 levels to have a smooth learning curve. Visually it looks great. Fits with the style, and it's visible but subtle. Not sure how it would work when there's no space, like when a lilypad is on the edge of the pond or there are multiply lilypads lined up. Also wondering how to best implement it. Perhaps grab the computed style for each lilypad, then apply a class based on each's flex-direction. Thanks for the fix. Agree, though technically valid to leave off the semicolon for the last rule in a ruleset, it would be good to give the suggestion. Ties into discussion in #15 about a warning/hint system. Great, thanks for this. Looks perfect, thanks! Gonna merge and add a link to PT-BR on the front page. Eventually I'd love to parse the answers and add some tailored, localized hints for common errors (like `row-reversed`). I'm collecting some analytics data on that. In the meantime, minor improvements could still be made to the feedback. There's subtle feedback in that the "Next" button changes from a disabled to active state. Maybe the color could also be changed from red to green when the level is solved. Hi @ralts00, thanks for the PR. Can you post some before/after screenshots? I like some of the changes, but would like to hold off on the stylistic changes for now, because there may be bigger color changes coming to make it more accessible to the colorblind. I do think the tweak to the yellow frog is an improvement. Thanks for discussion, guys. Images have been switched to SVG (see #22). Thanks for the bug report. Both answers should result in identical layouts, but the positions seems to be off by a few hundredths of a pixel. Fix on the way. I like the idea of auto applying styles. But I'm wondering what the role of the submit button should be then. For example, you type in the correct solution and the frog is on the lilypad. At that point, should the answer be checked automatically (removing the need for a submit button), or require a button click? If checked automatically, I could see it rushing the user onto the next level before they get a chance to see and internalize the problem/solution. But it might also feel redundant and pointless to require a button click after the frog is already on the lilypad. I like @tommarshall's idea for changing it to the "next" button. Gonna get to work on this... Ah, thanks for the fix! Nice catch, thanks! Would love your help in localizing this! I'll look into getting Froggy set up for localization, so you can drop in the translations. If you know any libraries that would help with this, please let me know. Hey @manuelitox, Flexbox Froggy is ready for translation! They can be added to the following files by including an `es` property beside the `en` one. I've already added a couple of test cases (using Google Translate). - [js/levels.js](https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/levels.js) - [js/docs.js](https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/docs.js) There are also a few strings that should be translated in [lang/es/index.html](https://github.com/thomaspark/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/lang/es/index.html) such as "Level" and "Next". The Spanish version will be available at http://flexboxfroggy.com/lang/es/. Look forward to your translations! Once it's ready, I'll add a link to the main page. @mvtenorio, would be great to also have a Portuguese translation. Let me know if you have any questions about how to add it to the project. @manuelitox, awesome! Added in c991397bc5169cc263faaddde41976c5744ea964! Thanks for the bug report, fix incoming. This is a great suggestion. Could you make some minor tweaks to PR? - Separate this as its own condition. Reason being that ctrl-return should submit no matter what, but if there's any whitespace before or after, it will be trimmed instead. - Have it be the first condition, again so it's guaranteed to submit. - Also check for `e.metaKey` for Mac. :+1: Looks good, thanks for this! I intended for the last level to be like a video game boss fight, so it is meant to be tougher than the others for sure. But that doesn't mean I expect people to memorize all of the properties and values. I actually added a few features (which might not all be obvious) to encourage people to flip back and forth to earlier lessons as reference: - You can hit the back and prev level buttons - Your state is saved whenever you move to a different level - You can hover any property name to view a tooltip reference - You can click "Level n of 24" to jump directly to any level and see their completion state I only did this at the end so it doesn't break the flow. My hope is the last level gives players a real sense of accomplishment for beating the game. That's fair enough. Listing all of the properties in the final level text would definitely reduce frustration, and should keep much of the challenge. Sweet, thanks for the fix! It works like `z-index` in that if the value is greater than the value of the others (in this case, the default 0), it'll be moved to the end of the order. So 1, 2, 3,... are all valid answers. No problem! Thanks @chikamichi, great idea. Right now it's not obvious (let alone satisfying) that you've won the game, and you even miss out on the "fly out" animation of every other level. Gonna add something shortly. Here's a screenshot of the new end screen: Thanks for the suggestion. Those properties are pretty tricky, but I'd still like to incorporate them into the game somehow. Same goes for a few values I skipped, like `baseline`, and `stretch`.

Saw the settings update and decided to add Latvian translation right away. While playing through to recheck my previous translation, found that some more errors and fixed them as well. Enjoy! Though the settings translation works perfectly, there is still some problem with level number 10 in Latvian version. I thought that adding the missing paragraph tag would fix it, but apparently it doesn't. From what I can see it looks equally formatted to other translations that work just as expected. In docs.js line 165. Stops execution of js and seems to break hover tooltips. Added Latvian translations. Deletions that show up in files are simply added commas after Macedonian translations. I re-did this twice, thinking that it may have been something on my end, only to realize that everything seems to work fine, just difference looks weird. If anyone has suggestions how to avoid this here or in future, let me know. This is my first contribution to open source and I picked this project because it really helped me to improve my knowledge and application of CSS flexbox. Thanks, though right now it still shows english version when I choose Latvian on the site! Yes, that was the case! Thanks! This PR adds a color blind friendly mode. Dark shapes are added to the frogs' bellies and corresponding lily pads, so that frogs can be matched by the shape, rather than by the color. A button is added below the code entry box to toggle the mode on or off. The setting is stored in localStorage. This is achieved by loading in different SVG files for the frog div backgrounds. Since we're loading SVG images as a background, I didn't see any clean way of dynamically adding the new shapes to the SVG. This has been tested by a student of mine with red-green colorblindness, and gets his thumbs up. If you want to try it for yourself, https://ajrussellaudio.github.io/flexboxfroggy/ Resolves #81 Yeah, maybe I did overstate it a little, thanks for the feedback! Deprecate 1) importing the Parse library in `index.html` and 2) corresponding code in `js/game.js` Add Macedonian language translations. Created a separate pull request as I don't think it was related to the easy/hard mode PR You will have to merge both PR's for it to fix the hardmode. i.e merge in this first then the hardmode. On Tue, Feb 6, 2018 at 4:29 PM Thomas Park wrote: > Merged #130 . > > — > You are receiving this because you authored the thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > , > or mute the thread > > . > When in hard mode hide instructions and go to random level, medium just hide instructions, easy normal Sure thing. Glad you like it On Mon, Jan 29, 2018 at 2:14 PM Thomas Park wrote: > Hey @mcshiz , thanks for this pull request, > looks good and I love the idea of randomizing levels on top of hiding the > instructions. > > One issue is that it won't be immediately obvious what the different > levels do. How about if we do a pop-up (like for languages) for > Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced with short descriptions of what each does. > Would you be up for working on that? > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > , > or mute the thread > > . > Ok, I added some directions to a tooltip like the languages Any updates on this? - Fix some typos, missing parts and translation mistakes - Update the instruction text on winner page to be up to date PS. I am native Mandarin speaker. Same as https://github.com/thomaspark/gridgarden/pull/61 🥕 fix typo 親哇 => 青蛙 I finished the Greek translation for Flexbox Froggy. Please let me know in case there is anything that needs fixing. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19245567/32102458-0b253764-bb3a-11e7-849f-ffc50940a50a.png) yeah, I figured it out. They were due to the addons. welcome On Wed, Jan 24, 2018 at 8:19 PM, Thomas Park wrote: > Thanks. > > — > You are receiving this because you authored the thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > , > or mute the thread > > . > Loved your tutorial. My mother tongue **Malayalam** was missing from the language list. I have added translations for the aforementioned language. Fixes #112 @thomaspark here is a quick PR to fill the container height of the `line-numbers` class. When looking at the container for code, there seems to be a hairline gap at the bottom of the code lines. Adding `height: 100%` to the `.line-numbers` class seems to fix this. I wanted to post this here in the event that it was helpful. Happy to make a PR if desired. Without `height: 100%`: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4694018/28731555-64183888-73a2-11e7-9526-6f86cea5bd6e.png) With `height: 100%`: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4694018/28731581-7ef6a82e-73a2-11e7-98f9-28903e812f6f.png) There is an error when loading page. Seems to be happening only on Chrome and recently (about a week ago). ``` Uncaught ReferenceError: Parse is not defined at game.js:1 ``` ``` Parse.initialize("FwVMmzHookZZ5j9F9ILc2E5MT5ufabuV7hCXKSeu"); ``` Browser: Chrome Version 60.0.3112.78 (Official Build) (64-bit) OS: macOs Sierra 10.12.4 It happens even if I try a hard reload from dev mode. My bad. In incognito mode it does work. I've tried clearing the entire cache of my browser, I've also manually cleared the cache data and local storage data for the page, but it still happens. What could be happening here? Cheers. You are totally right. Stands app was blocking https://unpkg.com site. Thanks a lot for your support. Regards. Would be nice to provide a solution/explanation for anyone who simply cannot figure one out ;-) Level 15, I expected `order: 1;` (or `order: 0;`) to move the red frog to the first lilypad. To be sure, `order: 5; ` does put the red frog on the 5th lilypad (ie, nothing is reversed). However _any other value_ for order, keeps the red frog on the 4th (starting) lilypad! I cannot get it to move to 1st, 2nd, or 3rd lilypad with `order: 1;`, `order: 2;`, or `order:3;` or `order:0;`. All other levels work fine for me (though level 24 vexed me with `wrap-reverse`). Am I just missing something obvious ? I'm using chrome, on win 7, in full screen. I see now that I misunderstood how `order` works. The first `order` exercise gave me a false impression that I understood how it worked, as `order: 3` was correct. Being forced to move the frog to the first position on the first exercise would have be more beneficial, IMHO. There would be no ambiguity of a wrong answer appearing correct, and being accepted as correct. Additionally, the instructions on the previous page clearly point out that "all items have a default order of '0'", so trying `-1` would have been a natural choice. By the time I got to this exercise, I no longer had this clue, **and** I had false idea of how it worked. > ..starting from the lowest numbered ordinal group and going up. Items with the same ordinal group are laid out in the order they appear in the source document. at https://tympanus.net/codrops/css_reference/flexbox/#section_order clarified this for me. Also, swapping the order of the two `order` exercises might have be helpful. Add romanian language and reordered language menu. Done. :) I realized Persian translation had some typo errors so I've fixed it. You're welcome. I'd be glad to help even a little bit I just completed the game and it is very informative. I like how the challenges get progressively more difficult, while maintaining the option for help with the hovers, you really did a good job of it! The thing with learning something new is that there is no way of remembering this stuff without repetition & at the end of the game, the user is told that they have done well and are sent on their way, my first feature request would be a cheat-sheet that they can download, to help them remember what they have learned. It would be good if the contributors could make one that is frog themed. Or, with the authors permissions, we could add links to an existing cheat-sheet such as one of the following: - https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/ - http://jonibologna.com/flexbox-cheatsheet/ - http://yoksel.github.io/flex-cheatsheet/ Secondly, even if the user gets the correct answer they may not understand the logic, that is why websites such as Code Academy and Udacity have answer text / videos respectively, to explain the logic behind the answer. Maybe you could have an explanation of the answer shown once the user has answered correctly, just to walk them though the logic. I realise that I have touched on a lot of points here & I would quite happily be a contributor to your project, I'm just putting my thoughts on the table. Change `estirán` by `estiran` Is there a way to play this game more than once? Reloading and clearing out the storage doesn't seem to make a difference. Every level is always already completed. Oh cool. I totally missed that! Haha Thanks I could translate but left it in English because the phrase is usually written in English in Japanese culture. I'm sure that most Japanese understand it and feel comfortable. But do you want me to add a comment there to make it clear? Added Tamil Language Translations Hey @gbhasha, thanks for the Tamil translation. Couple things: * `docs.js`, which contains the property definitions, also needs to be translated. * In readme, the Tamil line should be put alphabetically with the other languages. Once these changes are made, I'll merge it in! Added Tamil Translation. Learning (and recalling) flexbox layout properties with Flexbox Froggy is fun! Now grid layout is here! http://caniuse.com/#search=grid https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/complete-guide-grid/ And it is already can be used with `@supports (display: grid) {}` It would be great to adapt **Froggy** to the new css layout module or make a new project, e.g. **Grid Giraffe** with variable neck sizes! Wow, just wow, great work! The garden theme is suited even more ) Thanks! On Apr 6, 2017 03:23, "Thomas Park" wrote: > [image: gridgarden] > > > Just put the finishing touches on Grid Garden: > > http://cssgridgarden.com/ > https://github.com/thomaspark/gridgarden > > Loved the Grid Giraffe idea but sadly couldn't get it to work. 😛 > > — > You are receiving this because you authored the thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > , > or mute the thread > > . > Hi Thomas, I liked your Flexbox Froggy so much that I decided to translate it to my native language - Serbian. Thank you for your hard work and awesome idea. Best, Danko Hey Thomas, it's done! If you need me to make more adjustments, I will be happy to do it. Good catch! Since I have been translating from English, maybe a word "hoppy" also need correction: https://github.com/dankoknad/flexboxfroggy/blob/gh-pages/js/levels.js#L759 ? Awesome! It was my pleasure, Thomas. Hey Thomas, The Flexboxfroggy game is really cool game, I learnt a lot. I thought I'd add a Hindi translation to it. -Shubham extra syllable in a word "запутать" Welcome :) This is the recommended way now, and the default Google provide. The MIT license present in this repo only mentions software and documentation. What about the images? If I stole them for some other project, would that be okay? A small parenthetical phrase would suffice: "...to any person obtaining a copy of this software, included media files, and associated documentation files...". Can you make a color-blind / color-deficient mode? It's extremely difficult for some people to see the difference between the red and green frogs and lilly pads. Thanks for considering! Excellent learning resources. Just change the green frog and target pad to blue. [Like this.](https://imgur.com/a/3tqMC?) That will fix the most common color-blindness (red-green) Then you can keep adding incremental schemes for the other forms.
